text: The Sapir-Whorf hypothesis suggests language influences thought.
Cognitive dissonance occurs when beliefs contradict behaviors.
Plato's allegory of the cave explores perception vs. reality.
Object-oriented programming focuses on creating reusable code.
Chomsky's universal grammar theory proposes innate language ability.
The bystander effect explains reduced helping in crowds.
Descartes' 'I think, therefore I am' establishes existence.
Machine learning algorithms improve with more data.
Phonemes are the smallest units of sound in language.
The halting problem proves some computations are undecidable.
